items.preText: 11.59am Alright then, the players are out in the middle. The sun's beating down. Tamim Iqbal on strike and Lakmal to start off. Sahadat Sahad : "Good move to pick Saifuddin. Spinners might not get the grip as they want in the later part of the day. Hoping for a exciting clash between Bangladesh ex coach and current players " Rafayet Ullah: "I think BCB should learn lesson from Sri Lanka. If they too much rely on senior players then their future will be worse then Sri Lanka." Atiq: "Just saw BD has 5 points and ZIM has 4 though both have own one match respectively. Wondering how are the points calculated ?" Because Bangladesh chased down the target in less than 40 overs, they have a bonus point. 11.38am Bangladesh have picked Mohammad Saifuddin to replace Sunzamul Islam in a bid to further strengthen the pace attack. Bangladesh XI: Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Anamul Haque, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mahmudullah, 5 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 6 Nasir Hossain, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Rubel Hossain, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Two changes for Sri Lanka. Apart from Mathews, Dushmantha Chameera also misses out, and in their place come Nuwan Pradeep and Niroshan Dickwella. Sri Lanka XI: 1 Upul Tharanga, 2 Kusal Perera, 3 Dinesh Chandimal (capt), 4 Niroshan Dickwella, 5 Kusal Mendis, 6 Asela Gunaratne, 7 Thisara Perera, 8 Akila Dananjaya, 9 Suranga Lakmal, 10 Wanindu Hasaranga, 11 Nuwan Pradeep 11.30am Bangladesh have won the toss and are batting first. DInesh Chandimal is leading Sri Lanka. Hafiz: "Waiting to see former BD coach vs current BD players match. Too excited!" 11.20am Bangladesh one, Zimbabwe one. Sri Lanka have ushered into Angelo Mathews' second coming as limited-overs captain with a defeat at the hands of Zimbabwe in a thriller in Mirpur's 100th ODI. It brought back memories of their bilateral series in 2017 where Zimbabwe prevailed 3-2. Can Sri Lanka bounce back and put up their first win of the tri-series as well? But for that, they will have to outplay a much stronger, more balanced Bangladesh team who have the added advantage of familiarity of conditions at home. Hello, and welcome to ESPNcricinfo's live coverage of the third match at Dhaka. Sri Lanka may also have to go in without Mathews, who is under an injury cloud. The Sri Lanka captain is one again dealing with hamstring issues, the struggles with which have come to become an overriding theme of this career. But Sri Lanka have the benefit of having Chandika Hathurusingha, who knows the ins and outs of the Bangladesh side. While we wait for the toss and teams, here's Madushka Balasuriya's preview to set you up.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: fullish, angling in on middle and straightening slightly, tucked through midwicket
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, 2 runs

items.text: edged and dropped. Chases a full awayswinger wway away from the body, and it's a straightforward catch for second slip. A little high but he was right behind it and formed the reverse cup but lets the ball burst through. Kusal Mendis the fielder
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: again chases a very wide fuller one and gets comprehensively beaten
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: now he keeps the bat inside the line as this one nips away outside off
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full, angled across outside off, bunts it into the off side
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText:
Nuwan Pradeep

Shahjahan: "Once upon a time there was four spinners in bd squad but now four peacer!!!! Wow...."
items.text: fullish, nips away outside off to take the outside edge to third man
items.shortText: Pradeep to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: full outside off, lunges forward into a drive and crunches it to the covers
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length ball on middle, flicked into deep midwicket through the gap for a brace
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: fullish length, angled across outside off, just presents the full face of the bat and punches down the ground through long-off
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: good length, rips away sharply outside off, takes a good stride forward and keeps the bat inside the line
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: yorker outside off, dug out from the crease. Good delivery
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: shot! A pristine straight drive. Very full around the fifth-stump channel, comes forward and punches with a straight bat to the left of mid-on
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, FOUR runs

items.text: fullish outside off, walks across and flicks to midwicket for a quick single
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: good length outside off, comes forward and defends with an open face to point
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: slightly short of a good length on middle and leg, tucked off the pads into the on side
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: good length on middle and off, pitching outside leg, defended back
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length, pitching outside leg and angled across, gets a good stride across and solidly blocks down the pitch
items.shortText: Lakmal to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short of a length, cuts in from outside off to find the inside edge and go down to fine leg
items.shortText: Pradeep to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: fullish, width on offer outside off, gets a good stride across and keeps the bat inside the line
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: back of a length, some awkward bounce as it keeps a little low outside off, defended off the bottom part of the bat
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short ball, getting over the leg stump as the batsman gets under it
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Mahneel: "Its fascinating to watch Tamims temperament now. He has wasted quite a few years by running down on almost every ball and being dismissed loosely. But his come back is a fairytale for us BD fans"
items.text: good length, pushed across outside off, gets a good stride across and hangs the bat out, skewed off the outside of the bat to backward point
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short of a length outside off, gets on top and drops it into the off side
items.postText: Hasan: "Bangladesh got a very long batting line up today. Up to wicket no. 9 has a reputation of being able bat comfortably. With this line up, anything less than 300 runs will be an upset for Bangladeshi fans."
items.shortText: Pradeep to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: short of a length, jags back in off the seam and finds the inside edge to hit him on the back pad
items.shortText: Lakmal to Anamul Haque, no run
